title: Rexburg–Madison County Airport
text:
Rexburg–Madison County Airport is a public use <a href="airport">airport</a> located one <a href="nautical%20mile">nautical mile</a> (2 <a href="kilometre">km</a>) northwest of the <a href="central%20business%20district">central business district</a> of <a href="Rexburg%2C%20Idaho">Rexburg</a>, a city in <a href="Madison%20County%2C%20Idaho">Madison County, Idaho</a>, United States. It is owned by the City of Rexburg and Madison County. This airport is included in the <a href="National%20Plan%20of%20Integrated%20Airport%20Systems">National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems</a> for 2011–2015, which <a href="FAA%20airport%20categories">categorized</a> it as a "<a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a>" facility.
Facilities and aircraft.
Rexburg–Madison County Airport covers an area of 144 <a href="acre">acre</a>s (58 <a href="hectare">ha</a>) at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 4,862 feet (1,482 m) above <a href="mean%20sea%20level">mean sea level</a>. It has one <a href="runway">runway</a> designated 17/35 with an <a href="asphalt">asphalt</a> surface measuring 4,204 by 75 feet (1,281 x 23 m).
For the 12-month period ending September 21, 2012, the airport had 31,150 aircraft operations, an average of 85 per day: 97.9% <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a>, 1.9% <a href="air%20taxi">air taxi</a>, and 0.2% <a href="military%20aviation">military</a>. At that time there were 68 aircraft based at this airport: 86.8% single-<a href="aircraft%20engine">engine</a>, 4.4% multi-engine, 4.4% <a href="helicopter">helicopter</a>, and 4.4% <a href="ultralight">ultralight</a>.
